intro: Loeflingia, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. They produce yellow composite flowers that resemble those of true dandelions. Loeflingia species are often found in grasslands and open areas, thriving in dry to moist conditions.
